benefits.title: Health benefits of herbs and spices: the past, the present, the future
benefits.summary: Herbs and spices have antioxidant properties, may lower cholesterol, and may have anticarcinogenic properties.

benefits.title: Culinary Herbs and Spices: Their Bioactive Properties, the Contribution of Polyphenols and the Challenges in Deducing Their True Health Benefits
benefits.summary: Herbs and spices contribute dietary polyphenols, which are associated with reducing the risk of chronic non-communicable diseases.

benefits.title: Enhancement of ATP generation capacity, antioxidant activity and immunomodulatory activities by Chinese Yang and Yin tonifying herbs
benefits.summary: Chinese tonifying herbs like Herba Cistanche, Ganoderma, and Cordyceps can help prevent and treat age-related diseases by enhancing ATP generation, antioxidant status, and immunomodulatory functions.

benefits.title: Nation-Based Occurrence and Endogenous Biological Reduction of Mycotoxins in Medicinal Herbs and Spices
benefits.summary: Medicinal herbs and spices are used for therapeutic purposes against various human diseases, but mycotoxins can cause serious problems for humans due to their endogenous food components.

benefits.title: Novel approaches in herbal cosmetics
benefits.summary: Herbs have beneficial properties such as sunscreen, antiaging, moisturizing, antioxidant, anticellulite, and antimicrobial effects, which can enhance the aesthetic appeal and performance of cosmetic products.

benefits.title: A review of herbal medicines in wound healing
benefits.summary: Herbal medicines pose great potential for effective treatment of minor wounds, involving disinfection, debridement, and provision of a suitable environment for aiding the natural course of healing.

benefits.title: Functional Foods and Herbs as Potential Immunoadjuvants and Medicines in Maintaining Healthy Immune System: A Commentary
benefits.summary: Herbs and traditional foods can strengthen the immune system, reduce inflammation, allergies, and help prevent long-term effects of oxidative stress on various organs and the aging process.
benefits.journal: Journal of Complementary and Integrative Medicine

benefits.title: Community Metabolic Interactions, Vitamin Production and Prebiotic Potential of Medicinal Herbs Used for Immunomodulation
benefits.summary: Medicinal herbs have immunomodulatory potential and can alter gut microbiota, leading to changes in short chain fatty acids, vitamin production, and potentially impacting host physiology and immune function.

benefits.title: Hawthorn (Crataegus spp.): An Updated Overview on Its Beneficial Properties
benefits.summary: Hawthorn (Crataegus spp.) is a popular herb with many health benefits, including medicinal and nutraceutical properties.

benefits.title: The role of herbs and spices in cancer prevention.
benefits.summary: Herbs and spices have antimicrobial, antioxidant, and antitumorigenic properties, potentially reducing cancer risk and modifying tumor behavior.

side effects.title: Commonly used herbal medicines in the United States: a review.
side effects.summary: Herbs can cause dangerous and lethal side effects, including direct toxic effects, allergic reactions, effects from contaminants, and interactions with drugs and other herbs.

side effects.title: Herbal nephropathy – a serious condition based on the innocence of nature
side effects.summary: Herbal supplements can cause kidney damage, including aristolochic nephropathy, due to contamination with heavy metals and other substances.
side effects.journal: Journal of Education, Health and Sport

side effects.title: The dangers of using herbs. What your patients need to know.
side effects.summary: Herbal remedies can have potential side effects like contamination and toxicity, and lack standardization and control.

side effects.title: The use of medicinal herbs by human immunodeficiency virus-infected patients.
side effects.summary: Herbal use can lead to adverse effects such as dermatitis, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, thrombocytopenia, coagulopathies, altered mental status, hepatotoxicity, and electrolyte disturbances.

side effects.title: Herbal medicines and kidney; friends or foes?
side effects.summary: Herbal products can cause side effects like nephropathy, hepatotoxicity, and pregnancy, but the true frequency of side effects is not known due to lack of large clinical trials.

side effects.title: Finding health in folklore, herbs and supplements: the good, the bad & the ugly. Part II-- The ugly.
side effects.summary: Herbal and supplement use can have adverse effects or toxicity, and potential for interactions with agents commonly used by mainstream practitioners.

side effects.title: STUDI FARMAKOVIGILANS PADA OBAT HERBAL
side effects.summary: Herbal medicines have an incidence of adverse drug reactions (ADR) at doses normally used in humans, with varying percentages in various places.

side effects.title: Herbal Medicine in the United States: Review of Efficacy, Safety, and Regulation
side effects.summary: Herbal products have many different side effects due to active ingredients, contaminants, or interactions with drugs.

side effects.title: Herb-Drug Interactions and Confounding in Clinical Trials
side effects.summary: Herb-drug interactions can reduce the efficacy of conventional medications or cause additive side effects.

dosage.title: Dosing effects of an antiosteoporosis herbal formula – a preclinical investigation using a rat model
dosage.summary: Herbal treatment with a weight ratio of 5:4:1 showed a beneficial effect on preserving bone mineral density in a dose-dependent manner, with a preference for higher dosage.

dosage.title: PEMANFAATAN HERBA SELEDRI (Apium graveolens L.) UNTUK MENURUNKAN KOLESTEROL DAN LIPID DALAM DARAH TIKUS PUTIH YANG DIBERI DIIT TINGGI KOLESTEROL DAN LEMAK
dosage.summary: Celery herb juice at dosages of 0.14 g/200 g bow/day, 0.72 g/200 g bow/day, and 3.0 g/200 g bow/day has lowering cholesterol and lipid effects, but does not decrease total cholesterol and total lipid concentration significantly.

dosage.title: Reviewing the Study on Dosage Forms of Chinese Medicinal Herb in Cancer Chemoprevention
dosage.summary: Dosage forms of Chinese medicinal herb in cancer chemoprevention include embolism, fat emulsion, antecedent, bangsome, polyester fine granule, polymeric micelle, implantation, and nano-formulation.
dosage.journal: Journal of Guangxi Academy of Sciences

dosage.title: Effects of herbal mixture (Jedi, Gbewutu and Opa-eyin) on the health status of juvenile African catfish (Clarias gariepinus)
dosage.summary: Opa-eyin showed a safe dosage range between 10ml and 15ml of inclusion level in herbal mixtures for juvenile African catfish.
dosage.journal: Egyptian journal of aquatic biology and fisheries

dosage.title: Comparison of Chinese herbs combined with half dosage ICS with entire dosage ICS in pediatric asthma clinical therapy
dosage.summary: Both Chinese herbs combined with half dosage ICS and entire dosage ICS have the same effects in asthma control, improving symptoms and airway inflammation.
dosage.journal: China Journal of Traditional Chinese Medicine and Pharmacy

dosage.title: Research on Asarum herb dosage of herbal decoction in Waitai Miyao
dosage.summary: The commonly used dosages of Asarum herb in Waitai Miyao were 13.8g, 27.6g, and 41.4g, with a range of 6.969g.
dosage.journal: China Journal of Traditional Chinese Medicine and Pharmacy

dosage.title: ANTIHYPERURICEMIA SCREENING OF Mimosa pudica L. HERB EXTRACT THROUGH ITS ANALGESICS AND ANTIINFLAMMATORY ACTIVITY ASSAY
dosage.summary: Herb extract of Mimosa pudica L at dosages of 125, 250, and 500 mg/kg of body weight inhibited pain and edema in mice.

dosage.title: Effects of Herbs Compound on Immunity Function and Anti-tiredness in Mice
dosage.summary: Higher doses of herbs compound can enhance anti-tiredness abilities and improve immune function in mice.
dosage.journal: Chinese Archives of Traditional Chinese Medicine

dosage.title: Hepatotoxicity or Hepatoprotection? Pattern Recognition for the Paradoxical Effect of the Chinese Herb Rheum palmatum L. in Treating Rat Liver Injury
dosage.summary: The hepatoprotective effect of rhubarb extract at the two lowest dosages is mainly expressed as a decrease in cellular injury, while high doses can induce liver cell fibrosis.

dosage.title: The Complete German Commission E Monographs: Therapeutic Guide to Herbal Medicines
dosage.summary: Dosages and formulations are specific to preparations sold in Germany that are not yet generally available in North America.
